page.title: 18AN ISOLATED FARM, BURPHAM
page.content: Peppering Farm lies in a fold of the South Downs facing west. The long slopes of the Downs are used for extensive growing of cereals, while cows graze the wetlands by the meandering River Arun. From the farm delightful views are obtained of the wooded slopes of Arundel Park, the fields of distant South Stoke Farm, and the lane leading to the converted lodge on the Park wall. Lanes lead off to the Downs which, while affording access for the farmer and walker are not much frequented by cars since there is no way out over the Downs. Large combines and other vehicles are used on the farm and are housed in picturesque buildings. Other lanes lead down to the wet-lands their verges full of wild flowers and the hedges covered with honeysuckle and blackberries.
